revised_title: High-Pressure Oxidation of Ethane: Formation of Alcohols, Aldehydes, and Acids
tldr: This study investigates the slow combustion of ethane at high pressures, revealing that up to 60% of the ethane can appear in the products as alcohols, aldehydes, and acids. The research demonstrates the formation of ethyl and methyl alcohols, aldehydes, and acids during the oxidation process, providing insights into the mechanism of combustion.
